results.brief_description: Discusses the causes and mechanism of congestive failure and explains what the patient and doctor may do to give relief and prevent recurrence.

results.title: Confrontation: a nurse and an addict
results.creator_credit: Peter Schnitzler and Extension Media Center, University of California
results.brief_description: Poses questions regarding the professionals’ approach toward drug users. Demonstrates the conflict that arises between a white middle class nurse and a drug addict from a ghetto in hospital on a methadone program.

results.title: Conformity and independence (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Stanley Milgram, Harry From and Calvin Communications
results.brief_description: The topic of conformity is at the heart of any course in social psychology, and any treatment of the topic must rely heavily on the classic materials of Sherif, Asch and to a lesser extent Milgram, Kelman, Crutchfield, Moscovici, etc. The phenomena of conformity are relevant to the students’ own experience. Demonstrates laboratory work while maximising student involvement.

results.title: The Confident learner: self-esteem in children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Thomas W. Gregroy and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how the teacher can create conditions whereby a child can learn to build a self image of competence, a willingness to take risks, an ability to deal with mistakes, and self motivation.

results.title: The Conductor. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A look at the art and technique of the conductor. In part one, conductor Verdon Williams discusses his role within the orchestra, use of the baton to keep rhythm; different kinds of rhythms; emphasising staccatto, accents; bringing in new instruments; starting and finishing each movement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Conducting good music
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog, David W. Ridgway and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A brief outline of the history of conducting leads to a discussion of conducting as a sign language, which translates the composer’s signs and instructions on the score into signals which the orchestra can follow. How each conductor gives their own interpretation to a work is shown by contrasting performances of the same passage conducted by different artists. Features the Vienna Symphony Orchestra.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milan Herzog, David W. Ridgway and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.description: A brief outline of the history of conducting leads to a discussion of conducting as a sign language, which translates the composer’s signs and instructions on the score into signals which the orchestra can follow. How each conductor gives their own interpretation to a work is shown by contrasting performances of the same passage conducted by different artists. Features the Vienna Symphony Orchestra.

results.title: Conditioned reflexes
results.creator_credit: Artkino Pictures, Brandon Films and Moscow Popular Science Film Studio
results.brief_description: Reviews some of the work of the Russian physiologist, Ivan Pavlov, whose experiments with conditioned reflexes paved the way to a better understanding of human and animal behaviour. The difference between blind instinct present in all animals from birth, and reflex reactions set up by conditioning to certain often repeated stimuli is made clear. The process of checking the reflexes is explained and its application in the treatment of certain neuroses in human beings is shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Artkino Pictures, Brandon Films and Moscow Popular Science Film Studio

results.title: Concrete pipes and pre-stressed products
results.brief_description: The manufacture of reinforced concrete products at Hume’s plant in Victoria. Welding the reinforcing for a concrete pipe and casting the pipe; preparing the reinforcing for slabs, beams and piles; pouring concrete and settling it with a mechanical vibrator; curing the concrete; transporting the finished goods to the site.
